title: Stuffed Seitan Roll with Champagne Rice

ingredients.content: 100 g tinned kidney beans, drained (drained weight)
60 g hard cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Place onions, garlic, pepper, soy sauce, beans and 10 g parsley in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add 100 g water and vital wheat gluten then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Tip out onto a large piece of cling film and flatten into a rectangle. Arrange courgette, carrot and celery in centre then roll up using cling film, enclosing vegetables in centre. Discard cling film and place roll in Varoma dish.

Place remaining 1000 g water in mixing bowl, place covered Varoma into position, then steam <b>40 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Towards end of steaming time, preheat oven to 200°C. Remove Varoma and place seitan roll in an oven-proof dish. Clean mixing bowl.
Place remaining 20 g parsley, basil, cheese and bread in mixing bowl then grate <b>7 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add egg and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Cover seitan roll with mixture then bake for 20 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make rice.
Place oil, shallots and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>. Transfer to simmering basket.

Place water, Champagne, salt and turmeric in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in rice. Stir well with spatula then cook <b>20 min/100°C/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and garnish with pecans, sliced banana and chives. Slice seitan roll and serve with the rice.

hintsAndTricks: Cut the courgette and carrot so that they are a similar size to the stick of celery.
